Privacy Policy.content: Let’s get started! Do you have a privacy policy?

triggers.resultReport: The Personal Information Protection Act (“PIPA”) requires societies to develop a privacy policy. A privacy policy is a document that describes the personal information we are collecting: why we are collecting it, what we use it for, how we keep it secure and when we have to disclose it. It will also include how a person can review what we are doing with it.
triggers.reply: Got it - I’m adding this to your to-do list.

triggers.resultReport: The Personal Information Protection Act (“PIPA”) requires societies to develop a privacy policy. A privacy policy is a document that describes the personal information we are collecting: why we are collecting it, what we use it for, how we keep it secure and when we have to disclose it. It will also include how a person can review what we are doing with it.
triggers.reply: Great! Let’s talk about your privacy policy.

extraInfo.title: What is a privacy policy?
extraInfo.content: A privacy policy is a document which describes whose personal information we are collecting: why we are collecting it, what we use it for, how and when we have to disclose it, and how a person can review what we are doing.

Privacy Policy.content: Who is covered by your privacy policy?

triggers.resultReport: The Personal Information Protection Act (“PIPA”) requires societies to develop a privacy policy. A privacy policy is a document that describes the personal information we are collecting: why we are collecting it, what we use it for, how we keep it secure and when we have to disclose it. It will also include how a person can review what we are doing with it.

The Personal Information Protection Act (“PIPA”) requires societies to develop a privacy policy. A privacy policy is a document that describes the personal information we are collecting: why we are collecting it, what we use it for, how we keep it secure and when we have to disclose it. It will also include how a person can review what we are doing with it.
triggers.reminder: Include all relevant individuals in your privacy policy
triggers.reply: Hmm, you might be missing a few people who should be covered.

Privacy Policy.content: Are your staff, directors and other volunteers trained on privacy policies

triggers.reminder: Train your team members on privacy policies
triggers.resultReport: Share your learnings with your team members to ensure policies are being followed across your non-profit.
Share your learnings with your team members to ensure policies are being followed across your non-profit.

Privacy Officer.content: Every non-profit needs to have one person who can answer questions about the collection, use, retention and disclosure of data. This role is called the Privacy Officer.
Does your non-profit have a designated privacy officer?

triggers.resultReport: Every non-profit is required to have one person who can answer questions about the collection, use, retention and disclosure of data. This role is called the Privacy Officer.
Every non-profit is required to have one person who can answer questions about the collection, use, retention and disclosure of data. This role is called the Privacy Officer.

Privacy Officer.content: Is your privacy officers contact information included in your privacy policy?

triggers.reminder: Include the privacy officers contact information in privacy policy
triggers.resultReport: Be sure to include the contact information for your privacy officer in your privacy policy.
triggers.reply: Be sure to add this to your privacy policy!

triggers.reminder: Include the privacy officers contact information in privacy policy
triggers.resultReport: Be sure to include the contact information for your privacy officer in your privacy policy.
triggers.reply: Add this to your privacy policy once you create it!

triggers.resultReport: Be sure to include the contact information for your privacy officer in your privacy policy.

Requests for Information.content: Sometimes a non-profit will get requests for information. If the non-profit provides community or social services, the request could be from clients. If it is an arts organization, requests might include donation related information. If the request is coming from member of a non-profit society, this is discussed in detail on the lawfornonprofits.ca website and FAQ's.
Does your privacy policy explain how someone could access the information you collect?

triggers.reminder: Describe how to request information in privacy policy
triggers.resultReport: Include this information in your privacy policy with the privacy officer’s contact information.
triggers.reply: Check out the suggested wording in your results at the end of the module to add this to your privacy policy!

triggers.reminder: Describe how to request information in privacy policy

triggers.reply: Be sure to add this to your privacy policy once you create it

Requests for Information.content: Have you received or expect to receive requests for information?

options.label: Someone looking for information about others
How their personal information is being used
Who has access to their personal information

triggers.reply: Great, they can have this information!

triggers.resultReport: If the information requested is: protected by solicitor-client privilege, part of an incomplete investigation/appeal, or part of a mediation/arbitration, don’t give out this information. If you plan to deny a request for information, consult a lawyer.

triggers.todo: Don’t disclose sensitive information. Consult a lawyer before denying a request
triggers.reply: Don’t give out this information. If you plan to deny a request for information, consult a lawyer.
triggers.resultReport: If the information requested is: protected by solicitor-client privilege, part of an incomplete investigation/appeal, or part of a mediation/arbitration, don’t give out this information. If you plan to deny a request for information, consult a lawyer.

options.label: Reveal personal information about another person
Threaten the safety/harm of another person?
Cause grave harm to the requester?

triggers.reply: Proceed with caution. If you plan to deny a request for information, consult a lawyer.
triggers.resultReport: If the information requested is: protected by solicitor-client privilege, part of an incomplete investigation/appeal, or part of a mediation/arbitration, don’t give out this information. If you plan to deny a request for information, consult a lawyer.

triggers.todo: Don’t disclose sensitive information. Consult a lawyer before denying a request
triggers.reply: Don’t give out this information. If you plan to deny a request for information, consult a lawyer.
triggers.resultReport: If the information requested would: reveal personal information about another person, threaten the safety/harm of another person, or cause grave harm to the requester, don’t give out this information.
